**剑刃戟**（glaive）是[NetHack](/index.php?title=NetHack/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "NetHack/zh-CN (page does not exist)")中的一种[武器](/wiki/%E6%AD%A6%E5%99%A8 "武器")。它是一种[长柄武器](/wiki/%E9%95%BF%E6%9F%84%E6%AD%A6%E5%99%A8 "长柄武器")，由[铁](/index.php?title=%E9%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "铁 (page does not exist)")制成，未[鉴定](/index.php?title=%E9%89%B4%E5%AE%9A\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "鉴定 (page does not exist)")时外观为**单刃长柄武器**（single-edged polearm）。

[武士](/index.php?title=%E6%AD%A6%E5%A3%AB\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "武士 (page does not exist)")职业的角色称呼此武器为**薙刀**（naginata）。

## 生成

[警卫员](/index.php?title=%E8%AD%A6%E5%8D%AB%E5%91%98\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "警卫员 (page does not exist)")和[士兵](/index.php?title=%E5%A3%AB%E5%85%B5\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "士兵 (page does not exist)")在生成时有可能[获得](/index.php?title=%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%E8%B5%B7%E5%A7%8B%E7%89%A9%E5%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "怪物起始物品 (page does not exist)")剑刃戟[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)。[巨魔](/index.php?title=%E5%B7%A8%E9%AD%94%EF%BC%88%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%E7%B1%BB%E5%88%AB%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "巨魔（怪物类别） (page does not exist)")类怪物生成时有1⁄8的概率获得一把剑刃戟[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)。

## 策略

剑刃戟在长柄武器中属于较为常见的类型，其重量（75 [aum](/index.php?title=Aum/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Aum/zh-CN (page does not exist)")）在长柄武器中是第三轻的，但伤害不及其他更轻的长柄武器。它对[小型](/index.php?title=%E5%B0%8F%E5%9E%8B\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "小型 (page does not exist)")怪物的伤害在所有长柄武器中最低，对[大型](/index.php?title=%E5%A4%A7%E5%9E%8B\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "大型 (page does not exist)")怪物的伤害则较好。

## 历史

剑刃戟最初于[NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d")加入游戏。

薙刀

**翻译者从[英文条目](/wiki/Glaive#Origin "Glaive")翻译下文的部分内容时遇到困难。**  
如果可以，您可以帮助我们[**改善此页面的内容**](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Glaive/zh-CN\&action=edit)。

剑刃戟（glaive，有时也拼作glave）是一种起源自欧洲的长柄武器，它因自身独特的设计和多样的实战应用手段而闻名。剑刃戟的刀刃一般长约45厘米，单侧开刃，以承插轴固定在约2米长的握柄一端，其设计类似于战镰、日本的薙刀或中国的关刀。部分剑刃戟还会在刀背上铸一钩状物来提升其应对骑兵的能力，称为“草铁剑刃戟”（glaive-guisarme）。

“薙刀”是日本的一种传统长柄武器，主要由武士、步兵、武僧和女武者使用。薙刀通常有木制或金属制，截面为椭圆形，长度在120至240厘米间的长柄，一端固定有细长弯曲，长度在30至60厘米间的单刃刀片，刃和柄之间一般有一个圆形的护手，刀刃一般嵌入到柄中，并以木桩固定。

## Variants

**此条目或段落的部分内容需要翻译。**  
您可以帮助我们[**翻译此页面**](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Glaive/zh-CN\&action=edit)，但**请勿使用机器翻译**。

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), the glaive can be poisoned, and the [naginata](/index.php?title=Naginata_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Naginata (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") is made into a separate weapon from the standard glaive. An [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem") may be generated with a glaive.

There are two [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") glaives:

- [The Silence Glaive](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Silence_Glaive "DNetHack artifacts") is an unaligned artifact that has +1 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals +1 [life drain](/wiki/Life_drain "Life drain") damage and drains a level from monsters without [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") on each hit. While wielded, The Silence Glaive grants drain resistance, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") for three effects:

  - Invoking The Silence Glaive and specifying a cardinal direction fires a [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") in that direction, with damage calculated using the wielder's [attack spells](/wiki/Attack_spells "Attack spells") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill").
  - Invoking The Silence Glaive and pressing up provides extrinsic [protection](/wiki/Protection "Protection"), using the wielder's [clerical spells](/wiki/Clerical_spells "Clerical spells") skill.
  - Invoking The Silence Glaive and pressing down kills all [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")-able monsters on the level, including the wielder, and triggers three [earthquakes](/index.php?title=Earthquake\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Earthquake (page does not exist)") - this cannot be circumvented by [polyself](/wiki/Polyself "Polyself") into a monster that cannot be genocided, such as a [titan](/wiki/Titan "Titan"), though [life saving](/wiki/Life_saving "Life saving") will save the character as normal.

- [The Glaive of Shamsiel](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Glaive_of_Shamsiel "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful intelligent artifact that is large and made of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver"), and grants +1d7 to-hit and +1d10 damage versus all monsters. While wielded, the Glaive of Shamsiel grants [automatic searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching") and [blindness resistance](/wiki/Blindness_resistance "Blindness resistance"), and acts as a [light source](/wiki/Light_source "Light source"); targets that it strikes may be [blinded](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), [gremlins](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") are reduced to dust, and [trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") are [petrified](/wiki/Petrified "Petrified").

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), the glaive is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the glaive is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [Imhullu](/index.php?title=Imhullu\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Imhullu (page does not exist)") is a [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") artifact glaive that has +d4 to-hit and deals +d5 [wind](/index.php?title=Wind\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wind (page does not exist)") damage. While wielded, it grants resistance against clobbering/hurtling attacks, and deals +3d4 bonus damage against small monsters 1⁄3 of the time. [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") Imhullu has the same effect as a [scroll of air](/index.php?title=Scroll_of_air\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Scroll of air (page does not exist)").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), a glaive can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") and a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"); a glaive can be combined with a [javelin](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin") at a forge to create a [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance"). This also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [troll](/wiki/Troll_\(starting_race\) "Troll (starting race)") characters that are not [Convicts](/wiki/Convict "Convict") have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with a glaive as their starting polearm.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") retains forging recipes from EvilHack, and adds Imhullu from SpliceHack.

## 百科文本

### 剑刃戟

- *请参阅[长柄武器的百科文本](/wiki/%E9%95%BF%E6%9F%84%E6%AD%A6%E5%99%A8#.E7.99.BE.E7.A7.91.E6.96.87.E6.9C.AC "长柄武器")。*

### 薙刀

A Japanese pole-arm, fitted with a curved single-edged blade.  
The blades ranged in length from two to four feet, mounted on  
shafts about four to five feet long. The naginata were cut  
with a series of short grooves near to the tang, above which  
the back edge was thinned, but not sharpened, so that the  
greater part of the blade was a flattened diamond shape in  
section. Seen in profile, the curve is slight or non-  
existent near the tang, becoming more pronounced towards the  
point.  
  
"With his naginata he killed five, but with the sixth it  
snapped asunder in the midst and, flinging it away, he drew  
his sword, wielding it in the zigzag style, the interlacing,  
cross, reversed dragonfly, waterwheel, and eight-sides-at-  
once styles of fencing and cutting down eight men; but as he  
brought down the ninth with a mighty blow on the helmet, the  
blade snapped at the hilt."

\[ Story of Tsutsui no Jomio Meishu from Tales of Heike ]

剑刃戟（glaive）是NetHack中的一种武器。它是一种长柄武器，由铁制成，未鉴定时外观为单刃长柄武器（single-edged polearm）。

武士职业的角色称呼此武器为薙刀（naginata）。

策略

剑刃戟在长柄武器中属于较为常见的类型，其重量（75 aum）在长柄武器中是第三轻的，但伤害不及其他更轻的长柄武器。它对小型怪物的伤害在所有长柄武器中最低，对大型怪物的伤害则较好。

剑刃戟最初于NetHack 1.3d加入游戏。

'''剑刃戟'''（glaive）是{{cnlink|NetHack}}中的一种[[武器]]。它是一种[[长柄武器]]，由[[铁]]制成，未[[鉴定]]时外观为'''单刃长柄武器'''（single-edged polearm）。

[[武士]]职业的角色称呼此武器为'''薙刀'''（naginata）。

== 生成 ==
[[警卫员]]和[[士兵]]在生成时有可能[[怪物起始物品|获得]]剑刃戟{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|194|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}。[[巨魔（怪物类别）|巨魔]]类怪物生成时有{{frac|8}}的概率获得一把剑刃戟{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|448|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}。

== 策略 ==
剑刃戟在长柄武器中属于较为常见的类型，其重量（75 {{cnlink|aum}}）在长柄武器中是第三轻的，但伤害不及其他更轻的长柄武器。它对[[小型]]怪物的伤害在所有长柄武器中最低，对[[大型]]怪物的伤害则较好。

== 历史 ==
剑刃戟最初于[[NetHack 1.3d]]加入游戏。

{{translation/zh-CN|p|glaive#Origin}}
剑刃戟（glaive，有时也拼作glave）是一种起源自欧洲的长柄武器，它因自身独特的设计和多样的实战应用手段而闻名。剑刃戟的刀刃一般长约45厘米，单侧开刃，以承插轴固定在约2米长的握柄一端，其设计类似于战镰、日本的薙刀或中国的关刀。部分剑刃戟还会在刀背上铸一钩状物来提升其应对骑兵的能力，称为“草铁剑刃戟”（glaive-guisarme）。

“薙刀”是日本的一种传统长柄武器，主要由武士、步兵、武僧和女武者使用。薙刀通常有木制或金属制，截面为椭圆形，长度在120至240厘米间的长柄，一端固定有细长弯曲，长度在30至60厘米间的单刃刀片，刃和柄之间一般有一个圆形的护手，刀刃一般嵌入到柄中，并以木桩固定。

==Variants==
{{translation/zh-CN|n}}
===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], the glaive can be poisoned, and the [[Naginata (dNetHack)|naginata]] is made into a separate weapon from the standard glaive. An [[iron golem]] may be generated with a glaive.

There are two [[artifact]] glaives:

* [[dNetHack artifacts#The Silence Glaive|The Silence Glaive]] is an unaligned artifact that has +1 [[to-hit]] and deals +1 [[life drain]] damage and drains a level from monsters without [[drain resistance]] on each hit. While wielded, The Silence Glaive grants drain resistance, and can be [[invoke]]d for three effects:
** Invoking The Silence Glaive and specifying a cardinal direction fires a [[magic missile]] in that direction, with damage calculated using the wielder's [[attack spells]] [[skill]].
** Invoking The Silence Glaive and pressing up provides extrinsic [[protection]], using the wielder's [[clerical spells]] skill.
** Invoking The Silence Glaive and pressing down kills all [[genocide]]-able monsters on the level, including the wielder, and triggers three [[earthquake]]s - this cannot be circumvented by [[polyself]] into a monster that cannot be genocided, such as a [[titan]], though [[life saving]] will save the character as normal.
* [[dNetHack artifacts#Glaive of Shamsiel|The Glaive of Shamsiel]] is a lawful intelligent artifact that is large and made of [[silver]], and grants +1d7 to-hit and +1d10 damage versus all monsters. While wielded, the Glaive of Shamsiel grants [[automatic searching]] and [[blindness resistance]], and acts as a [[light source]]; targets that it strikes may be [[blind]]ed, [[gremlin]]s are reduced to dust, and [[Troll (monster class)|trolls]] are [[petrified]].

===NetHack Fourk===
In [[NetHack Fourk]], the glaive is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], the glaive is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], [[Imhullu]] is a [[neutral]] artifact glaive that has +d4 to-hit and deals +d5 [[wind]] damage. While wielded, it grants resistance against clobbering/hurtling attacks, and deals +3d4 bonus damage against small monsters {{frac|3}} of the time. [[Invoking]] Imhullu has the same effect as a [[scroll of air]].

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], a glaive can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[short sword]] and a [[spear]]; a glaive can be combined with a [[javelin]] at a forge to create a [[lance]]. This also applies to [[Hack'EM]].

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], [[Troll (starting race)|troll]] characters that are not [[Convict]]s have a {{frac|4}} chance of generating with a glaive as their starting polearm.

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] retains forging recipes from EvilHack, and adds Imhullu from SpliceHack.

=== 薙刀 ===
{{encyclopedia|
A Japanese pole-arm, fitted with a curved single-edged blade.
The blades ranged in length from two to four feet, mounted on
shafts about four to five feet long.  The naginata were cut
with a series of short grooves near to the tang, above which
the back edge was thinned, but not sharpened, so that the
greater part of the blade was a flattened diamond shape in
section.  Seen in profile, the curve is slight or non-
existent near the tang, becoming more pronounced towards the
point.

"With his naginata he killed five, but with the sixth it
snapped asunder in the midst and, flinging it away, he drew
his sword, wielding it in the zigzag style, the interlacing,
cross, reversed dragonfly, waterwheel, and eight-sides-at-
once styles of fencing and cutting down eight men; but as he
brought down the ninth with a mighty blow on the helmet, the
blade snapped at the hilt."
|[ Story of Tsutsui no Jomio Meishu from Tales of Heike ]
}}
